intro: Boehmeria thorelii, commonly known as Chinese nettle, is a flowering plant species native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other members commonly referred to as nettles. The plant is characterized by its finely serrated leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that grow in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Boehmeria thorelii is also valued for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and textiles.
